entry.title: Orchard Beginner : Content Types in Orchard
entry.content:
Welcome to Orchard Beginner! A Content Type is a blueprint of how content items of that type look like: it defines the set of content parts that make up the content types.

A content type only consists of content parts, even if it seems that you can directly attach content fields to a content type from the admin UI. When you attach fields from the admin UI in reality an invisible part is created that has the same name as the content type(e.g. a Page part is created for the Page content type) and the fields get attached to that.

entry.title: Orchard Beginner : Content Items in Orchard
entry.content: Welcome to Orchard Beginner! Content Items are instances of Content Types, just like objects are instances of classes. Content Items are the heart and soul of Orchard i.e. they store all the data you need to handle and display.

entry.title: Installing Orchard CMS using SQL Server
entry.content: Welcome to Orchard Beginner! Today we'll learn how to install Orchard CMS using Microsoft WebMatrix and SQL Server.

entry.title: Installing Orchard CMS using SQL Server CE
entry.content: Welcome to Orchard Beginner! Today we'll learn how to install Orchard CMS using Microsoft WebMatrix and SQL Server CE(Compact Edition).

entry.title: Orchard Beginner - Comments in Orchard
entry.content: Welcome to Orchard Beginner! Comments are what make a blog/website more interactive and more social. In this post we'll be talking about how to handle and moderate comments for your Orchard website. Let's get started.
